structure.unit: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES -- PROHIBITIONS, RESTRICTIONS, AND REGULATIONS

law.catch_line: Containers that package retailer may purchase, keep, or sell in.

text.section: No retailer of distilled spirits or wine by the package shall purchase, keep upon the licensed premises, or sell any distilled spirits or wine by the package in any container except in the original sealed package containing quantities of not less than two hundred (200) milliliters of distilled spirits or one hundred (100) milliliters of wine and not exceeding one and seventy-five hundredths (1.75) liters of distilled spirits or two hundred twenty (220) liters of wine. Containers of fifty (50) milliliters for distilled spirits shall be permitted.
Each container shall have affixed to it all labels as may be required by the administrative regulations of the board, together with all required federal revenue tax stamps.
No container shall be opened nor its contents consumed on the licensed premises unless the licensee also holds a retail drink license.

law.history: Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 228, sec. 2, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 194, sec. 25, effective June 17, 1978. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-184.
